Hippie
You are 28% Rational, 71% Extroverted, 14% Brutal, and 28% Arrogant.
You are the Hippie! Characterized by a strong sense of extroversion, irrationality, gentleness, and humility, you no doubt frolic through fields preaching peace and love to all! You are probably either very spiritual or needlessly paranoid about "the man", like most hippies, as a result of your focus on intuition and feelings over cold, brutal logic. You are also very, very social. And like any hippie, who would have no qualms about hitchiking across the country just to meet some interesting people, you too love to interact with others, even complete strangers. Because we know most any hippie is peace-loving and humble, it stands to reason that you, as well, are terribly gentle and humble, almost to the point of revulsion. Your carefree attitude of peace and harmony is probably very, very sickening to realists or cynics or anyone who isn't a hippie, to tell the truth. In short, your personality is defective because you are overly emotional, extroverted, gentle, and humble--thus making you an annoying hippie. And you listen to psychadelic rock and smoke a whole lot of pot. Okay, maybe not, but I wouldn't be surprised if you did.

To put it less negatively:

1. You are more INTUITIVE than rational.

2. You are more EXTROVERTED than introverted.

3. You are more GENTLE than brutal.

4. You are more HUMBLE than arrogant.

Compatibility:

Your exact opposite is the Sociopath.

Other personalities you would probably get along with are the Hand-Raiser, the Televangelist, and the Robot.

*

*

Your Birthdate: March 19
Your birth on the 19th day of the month adds a tone of independence and extra energy to your life path. But at the same time, it poses a number of obstacles to overcome before you are able to be as independent as you would like. The number 1 energy suggests more executive ability and leadership qualities than your path may have indicated. A birthday on the 19th of any month gives greater will power and self-confidence, and very often a rather original approach. However, a somewhat self-centered approach to life that may be in conflict with some of the other influences in your life. This 1 energy may diminish your ability and desire to handle details, preferring instead to paint with a broad brush. You are sensitive, but your feeling stay somewhat repressed. You have a compelling manner that can be dominating in many situations. You do not tend to follow convention or take advice very well. Consequently, you tend to learn through experience; sometimes hard experiences. The 19/1 is a loner number and you may experience feelings of being alone even if you are married. You may take on a tendency to be nervous and angry.

So, freshman preview tonight. Do you remember when we were there. Seems like a lifetime ago. The whole thing is so crazy. Being there, describing the awesomeness that is choir got me thinking about all the amazing times we've had over the years. Especially freshman year, just getting to know each other, and New York funness. I definitely feel like I'm ready to leave TJ, start something new, but when it comes to choir, I'm dreading leaving it. This year has been interesting with clique-y-ness and stuff, but overall it's so nice to have all these wonderful people together and just talking, singing, being absolutely crazy... I'm gonna miss it a lot. So to all you choirites - I love you muchos. Thanks for making my time at TJ bearable.

Back from Vassar and UVa. I actually don't think there could be two more different schools, but I'll save the college entry for later, after Duke, except to say that my indecisiveness is going to be a problem, I think. 
There are so many random things which are going to be said right now, but you all will just have to deal. Or stop reading. Ha ;o) 
First, how beautiful was it today?! I am so ready for this gorgeous weather. It really boosts my mood. A lot. But it makes me think that it's later in the year than it is, which is both sad and happy. Because I'm glad that there is still time for funness in choir and hanging out with cool people, but I am sick of work and studying and the rest of school in general. 

OMG my right butt cheek really hurts. Just thought I'd let you in on that little secret. Fell off my pony on Saturday, and landed on this thing which held up the jump, and I have a huge bruise and it's ugly and my butt hurts. The end. haha. And AJ was kind of a brat at times this weekend. As I said, if he were a boy I would have dumped him, and then taken him back when he was an angel on Saturday afternoon. But I was harboring some unhappy feelings toward him at some points during the weekend. 

And, 8 hour car rides with my mom. Very hard to describe, and probably not all that entertaining to hear about unless you know my mom. But if you do, you can imagine that it was CRAZY. First, my mom is the most directionally challenged woman I have ever met. We have driven to and from the barn a thousand times, and she still has no idea how to get there or back. So I had to direct her, which is always fun. We were getting gas, and she swerved away because she saw a sign for Newark and Baltimore, and thought it was going North. (We were in Delaware.) Then every time we saw brake lights she screamed or made some noise. Then, by the time it had been 6 hours and we were passing through northern VA on the way to Charlottesville, she went crazy. It was really funny. On 29 she regressed to her southern accent. I think I laughed the entire time we were on 29, with her constant commentary. She kept saying, "daaamn huuhnay" and things like that. And she has really bad vision, and never wears her glasses, so she saw this sign that said "Airport motors" and exclaimed, "What are apricot motors?!" LOL. It was soo funny.  

Sorry if you actually read that all, but I hope you were entertained, or at least it helped procrastination ;o)

free enneagram test
That was kind of a fun thing to do... personality tests and online quizzes are generally so addictive. Hope everyone is having a good spring break?! It snowed/sleeted today in upstate NY, which was a little depressing, but it was nice yesterday, so that was happyful on my birthday. I'm 18! Crazy! And fun... so yeah. So, as most of you know I've been up here, "horsing" as some of my friends say... which has been really fun. And all the girls who work at the barn dressed up my horse for my birthday with tinsel in his mane and on his nose and red christmas bows and those "happy birthday" banners that you hang up on kids birthdays with the reflecty color things which was really cute and made me feel loved. :o) I've been having a really good time, but it's weird, because although I am a much better rider than I used to be and I am improving a lot, I've fallen off twice in the last two days. The second time was because AJ *my horse* was being a bum and a half and stopped right before a jump, so there was nothing I could do, but it seems counterintuitive that I would fall off more now that I am better than before. One of my old instructors told me that once you've fallen off 10 times you'd be a good rider. I've fallen off now about 18 times throughout the time that I've been riding and I guess I'm good enough, but nowhere near where I want to be. Oh well... the good thing is that I've never really been seriously hurt. This is going to sound kind of whiny and maybe immature, but I'm gonna say it anyway. (After all, that's what LJ is for, right?) It's just discouraging that it seems like everyone I know and all my friends have found out that they've gotten into at least one school, and I still haven't heard anything. And I'm sure I'll get in somewhere and be happy wherever I end up going, but I just feel left out and not smart. I know I am pretty smart, but I feel academically inferior to, like, the whole lunch group and a lot of people at TJ. Which hasn't really been an issue for me, because I can learn so much from everyone, and it's awesome that I have these amazing, brilliant friends, but sometimes I just wish I could be on the same level. At good old BFCDS I was always one of the smartest and it was kind of an ego boost, but I feel that since coming to TJ I haven't been in the top of anything, riding, singing, or school stuff. Which is fine, but I dunno, it's just nice to feel like you can do one thing really well, which I don't. So, sorry for the really long I've-just-fallen-off-for-the-2nd-time-in-2-days post. Hope everyone's having a good spring break, and if you're feeling bored and wanna talk, our number up here is 518-398-1885 (yes, we have a phone line up here, it's actually pathetic, but oh well :o) )

Oh man. So feeling randomly shitty and depressed (which is the point of having one of these) so I will write something for my once a month(ish) post. Anyway, I just feel like this year has not been the best. My classes suck but more importantly I feel like I haven't really seen or hung out with most of my friends in a while (though friday night was awesome). And it's depressing because I know it's my fault, and I know the exact cause, but I feel helpless in stopping what I am now calling my addiction. *this is going to be very cryptic to pretty much everybody reading this, just fyi, don't feel bad if you're like "what?" by addiction I do not mean drugs or alcohol or anything crazy like that* So I'm gonna try to be a better friend now...  
And people can be so dense sometimes. Which is frustrating. As Seethal said, we should ship all the stupid people (aka stupid people + republicans) off to Mars. Not that stupid and dense are the same... just a thought though. Do you ever do something and then you realize what you are doing (or saying) and think "oh my gosh is that me saying that?". Cuz sometimes I take a step back and think how could I be so needy and controlling and just bitchy? And then I feel bad. So basically, the root of my feeling ugly (and by ugly I mean depressed, because ugly is the ultimate adverb - and adjective) is me. Which is also ugly. It's just that with certain people, I want them to do a certain thing or respond a certain way, and then I feel bad and am like, dude, Gillet, just let people be themselves. But it doesn't stop me from wanting it... 

Okay well I don't know if that made any sense but I have kind of a long day ahead of me, so I'll try to sleep. (So glad I'm going to Cedar Crest tomorrow. So not glad I'll be in the car for 6 hours. Hmmph.)

Your Boobies' Names Are: Love Muffins

Get your own Boobie Names

Awesome. But does that mean that one boobie is "Love" and the other is "Muffins" or that they are both "Love Muffins"? Hmm... So I have a random not so funny but kind of interesting story about boobie names. Actually I have more than one, but I will only burden you, the crazy person who is reading this LJ post, with one. Does anyone remember the Evan and Jaron est. 1974 shirt I used to have? (I miss it! Evan and Jaron = the best!) Well anyway, the first time I wore it was the last day of camp. And this guy's brother was there to take him home, and so the guy introduced me to his brother, and before his brother said "hi" or "nice to meet you" or any of the normal greetings, he asked me if I had named my boobies Evan and Jaron. I of course, told him he shouldn't be looking at my boobies (hot as they are... ;oP) but it was kind of funny in a not laughing kind of way. But it had to do with Evan and Jaron, and that makes me happy. Wow I'm a freak. haha Hope everyone has a boobilicious last day of the long weekend! (And by boobilicious I mean great) ;o)
